p: Tannic acid ( 19) (IC 50 = 3 μM) and 3-isotheaflavin-3-gallate ( 20) (IC 50 = 7 μM) ( Fig. 5 ) were shown to be potent inhibitors of SARS 3CL pro by virtue of high-throughput screening of a natural product library (approx. 720 compounds) [ 48]. These two compounds form part to a group of natural polyphenols found in tea [ 45]. According to the results obtained, the extracts from Pu-erh tea and black tea were the most potent inhibitors of SARS protease [ 48]. It was also reported that bovine coronavirus and rotavirus infections could be neutralized by theaflavins extracted from black tea [ 49] with EC 50 of 34.7 μg/mL. The findings also corroborate the presence of an inactivation activity ( in vitro) of theaflavin and theaflavin gallate derivatives ( 20) against both rotavirus and coronavirus.
